intro: Aciotis acuminifolia, commonly known as the slender daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a daisy-like pattern. Aciotis acuminifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
